title: Why Not Mars (Idle Words)

last_post.content:
"When you hold on to a belief so strongly that neither facts nor reason can change it, what you are doing is no longer science, but religion. So I’ve come to believe the best way to look at our Mars program is as a faith-based initiative. There is a small cohort of people who really believe in going to Mars, the way some people believe in ghosts or cryptocurrency, and this group has an outsize effect on our space program."

https://idlewords.com/2023/1/why_not_mars.htm

#mars #space #nasa

title: Muse: Text-To-Image Generation via Masked Generative Transformers

last_post.content:
Muse: Text-To-Image Generation via Masked Generative Transformers

Presents Muse, a text-to-image Transformer model that achieves SotA image generation perf while being far more efficient than diffusion or AR models.

proj: https://muse-model.github.io/
abs: https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.00704

title: Papers and patents are becoming less disruptive over time - Nature

last_post.content:
I hadn't actually looked at the details of the #science is becoming less #disruptive paper (see here: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-022-05543-x), and only looked at it after reading Alex Usher's take on it (https://higheredstrategy.com/discovery-slowing/).

Now that I have, I gotta say: I think this paper tells us nothing about the #quality of science being done nowadays. Instead, it tells us much more about (1) the culture of #citations in science, and (2) the ease of finding and reading older papers.

title: cell.com/trends/cognitive-scie...

last_post.content: every paragraph in this paper is blowing my mind https://www.cell.com/trends/cognitive-sciences/fulltext/S1364-6613(22)00236-4 even as someone who already believed in the infinite variety of language, there are just so many deeply researched counterexamples to basically anything you think is universal (especially if you're using english as your basis for "universal")

title: Apache® Appropriation

last_post.content:
Native Americans are asking The Apache Software Foundation, "…to take the necessary steps needed to express the ally-ship they promote so deeply on their website, to act in accordance with their own code of conduct, to “be careful in the words that [they] choose”, and change their name."

It'll be a big change, but IMO one that's necessary and overdue.

https://blog.nativesintech.org/apache-appropriation/

#OpenSource

title: PyTorch

last_post.content: PyTorch, critical Machine Learning/AI library PyTorch breached, compromised with malicious software. If you run on the latest (unstable) versions, that requires immediate attention. https://pytorch.org/blog/compromised-nightly-dependency/

title: Separated Bike Lanes Means Safer Streets, Study Says

last_post.content:
Never forget, a 13-year study of a dozen cities found that protected bike-lanes led to a drastic decline in fatalities for all road users.

ALL ROAD USERS.

And painted bike-lanes? No safety improvement at all. As for sharrows, it’s safer to NOT have them.

Via @Streetsblog, read article linked below.

https://usa.streetsblog.org/2019/05/29/protect-yourself-separated-bike-lanes-means-safer-streets-study-says/

#bikelanes #bikes #cities #sharrows #infrastructure #urbanism #cars

title: Social Quitting - Cory Doctorow - Medium

last_post.content:
It’s January 9, and I just read the best article I will read all month.

“Social Quitting” by @pluralistic

“Once a platform has its users and business customers locked in, it can enshittify its service to the point of near uselessness without losing either, allocating all the useful surplus in the business to its shareholders.”

“The important thing about the Fediverse isn’t that it’s noncommercial or decentralized—it’s that its design impedes surplus harvesting.”

https://doctorow.medium.com/social-quitting-f049b33ad3f6

title: Die Schweiz führt eines der internetfeindlichsten Gesetze Europas ein- und niemanden interessierts - Das Netz ist politisch

last_post.content:
Das neue Jugendschutzgesetz sieht #Alterskontrollen für alle Spiel- und Videplattformen vor. D.h. vor dem ersten Anschauen eines #YouTube-Musikvideos (oder eines #Lehrvideos) muss man Google gegenüber beweisen, ob man volljährig sei.

Vorgeschlagen wird dafür die Übermittlung von Pass-/ID-Daten. Dafür gäbe es Alternativen, die @adfichter im aktuellen #DNIP-Artikel erläutert. Schade, dass unsere Politiker damals solche Überlegungen nicht anstellten. #Ausweiszwang https://dnip.ch/2023/01/05/die-schweiz-fuehrt-eines-der-internetfeindlichsten-gesetze-europas-ein-und-niemanden-interessierts/

title: Commentary: Cory Doctorow: Social Quitting

last_post.content:
In "Social Quitting," my latest *Locus Magazine* column, I advance a theory to explain the precipitous #VibeShift in how many of us view the once-dominant social media platforms, Facebook and Twitter, and how it is that we have so quickly gone asking what we can do to get these services out of our lives to where we should go now that we're all ready to leave them:

https://locusmag.com/2023/01/commentary-cory-doctorow-social-quitting/

1/

title: The Problem of Immigration in a Slaveholding Republic

last_post.content:
#Histodons #Immigration #Slavery #19thcentury

Proofs corrected. Index done. After ten years' research, this project is out of my hands and due for publication in April 2023.

https://global.oup.com/academic/product/the-problem-of-immigration-in-a-slaveholding-republic-9780197580080?prevNumResPerPage=20&prevSortField=1&sortField=8&resultsPerPage=20&start=0&lang=en&cc=us#

The book explains how the existence, abolition, and legacies of slavery shaped US immigration policy as it moved from the local to the national level over the course of the nineteenth century.

title: https://wisteria.richardboeser.com

last_post.content:
During the holidays I received this beautiful print from @richardboeser
It's an output from his long-form generative art project, called Wisteria -
all details at https://wisteria.richardboeser.com
His take on long-form-generative is interesting: every months he selects a few outputs, and sell them exclusively as 1/1 prints.
The quality of the printed work is really stunning - unfortunately, it can be only appreciated in person, so, if you like his work, trust me and order a print.

title: Microsoft’s new AI can simulate anyone’s voice with 3 seconds of audio

last_post.content:
Nothing to see here. Move along.

"Microsoft researchers announced a new text-to-speech AI model called VALL-E that can closely simulate a person's voice when given a three-second audio sample. Once it learns a specific voice, VALL-E can synthesize audio of that person saying anything—and do it in a way that attempts to preserve the speaker's emotional tone."

https://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2023/01/microsofts-new-ai-can-simulate-anyones-voice-with-3-seconds-of-audio/

title: GitHub - ropensci/bomrang: Australian government Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) data client for R

last_post.content: A sad day today, I've archived the @ropensci #RStats package, bomrang, https://github.com/ropensci/bomrang/. It was a great package with several citations, but BOM's unwillingness to allow programmatic access to their data just made this more reasonable than leaving it alive. The code is all still there so if anything changes, we can bring it out of hibernation...

title: GitHub - cboettig/quarto-hugo-material-dashboard: Adapting material-dashboard to Quarto and Hugo

last_post.content:
Have been enjoying @Posit #quarto but wanting more flexible layout /aesthetics for dashboards etc.

The hugo output format is great for this -- a bit more manual but much more flexible!

A sketch using custom elements below. Draft theme at https://github.com/cboettig/quarto-hugo-material-dashboard/ , feedback or suggestions welcome!

layout in quarto files uses {bslib} with ggplot/ggiraph charts.

title: NARCIS > Decommissioning NARCIS Portal

last_post.content: The NARCIS national gateway to Dutch scholarly information (incl. the option to explore Dutch repository content nationally) will be closed March 1 by DANS. OpenAIRE (Explorer) is suggested as the main alternative for browsing/filtering Dutch scholarly publication output. https://www.narcis.nl/decommission/Language/en
